Eighty years after Hiroshima and Nagasaki bombings, the fight for survivors' memories to live on
subhead: In Japan, the two cities have long promoted peace and nuclear disarmament, led by survivors of the 1945 nuclear bombings. As their voices fade, both cities are striving to carry their message forward.

title: Will tariffs eventually impact markets?
subhead: The 15% tariffs imposed by the US on European imports take effect on August 7. Markets have been expressing concern about the impact these tariffs could have on inflation and US economic growth.

title: Plastic pollution treaty talks open with 'global crisis' warning
subhead: Delegates from over 180 countries began final talks Tuesday in Geneva to craft a global treaty on plastic pollution, amid mounting pressure to curb a crisis threatening ecosystems, health, and the planet. 'The urgency is real, the evidence is clear – and the responsibility is on us,' said Ecuadorian diplomat Luis Vayas Valdivieso.

title: Greece becoming better equipped to fight wildfires
subhead: After hiring new firefighters and purchasing additional aircraft and drones, the country has reported a 34% decrease in burned areas since the start of 2025.

title: Lake Chad residents caught between Boko Haram and rising waters
subhead: 'Lake Chad's Troubled Waters' (1/4). Contrary to popular belief, the lake is not disappearing but expanding, to the dismay of residents already facing jihadist attacks. Confronted with the effects of climate change, they are organizing to better manage agricultural spaces.
byline: By Carol Valade (Lac province (Chad), special correspondent)

Eva Nguyen Binh, head of the Institut Français: 'Attacking culture has long-term consequences'
subhead: The president of the Institut Français, a French overseas cultural policy actor which has just had its contract renewed, discusses the challenges that cultural diplomacy faces in a time of geopolitical tensions.

title: Sydney Sweeney's American Eagle ad sparks controversy online and pleases Donald Trump
subhead: With a slogan playing on the ambiguity between 'genes' and 'jeans' − 'Sydney Sweeney has great jeans' − the actress has sparked controversy. Some have accused her of promoting eugenics, while President Donald Trump has come to American Eagle's defense, triggering a surge in its stock price.
byline: By Arnaud Leparmentier (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: Mariia Nazarenko's first days in France after fleeing Ukraine: 'In Kyiv, I was a university professor. Today, I am a refugee searching for toothpaste'
subhead: On February 21, 2022, Nazarenko left Ukraine, thinking it was just for a weekend. The next day, Russia invaded her country. A few days later, she found herself in Lyon. Now 40 years old, she lives in Paris.
